title: Austin Trips
summary: This project implements an ETL pipeline to process historical bike sharing data from Austin (2013â€“present). The goal is to enable stakeholders to make informed decisions on bike usage patterns, station performance, demand distribution, and vehicle/subscription trends. The pipeline extracts raw trip data, transforms it to calculate useful metrics (e.g., trips per kiosk, trips per hour, top stations, subscription and bike type analysis), and loads the results into a format suitable for visualization and analysis.
problem: Operations teams were missing critical anomalies in a sea of logs, leading to costly downtime and pager fatigue.
goal: Deliver a streaming observability experience with clear alerting so responders see what matters within seconds.
approach: Unified disparate telemetry sources into a governed Kafka pipeline, layered dbt models for business-ready metrics, and delivered a realtime UI with progressive disclosure.
results: On-call staff now act on high-signal alerts with shared context in a single workspace, reducing triage loops and improving customer uptime.

title: Forecast Studio
summary: Scenario planning workbench that helps finance and product teams test assumptions with explainable ML forecasts.
problem: Planning teams relied on brittle spreadsheets that broke under new scenarios and provided no traceability back to source data.
goal: Launch an explainable forecasting application that lets teams iterate on assumptions and share updates with confidence.
approach: Built a modular feature store, automated backtesting harness, and an interactive React front-end that visualises forecast uncertainty with human-readable insights.
results: Stakeholders can now simulate product launches and budget shifts in minutes while keeping an auditable trail of every change.

title: Unified Metrics Hub
summary: Centralised metrics platform standardising KPIs and refreshing executive scorecards in minutes instead of hours.
problem: Executives were making decisions from conflicting KPI decks generated by hand with stale extracts.
goal: Provide a governed metrics hub that syncs definitions across teams and automates board-ready scorecards.
approach: Modeled shared dimensions in Snowflake, orchestrated Dagster assets for incremental freshness, and shipped a React experience with row-level security.
results: Leadership now reviews the same trusted KPIs, refreshed nightly, with drill-ins for operational owners.

metrics.description: Reduction in analyst effort per cycle.
